text: Fra flaske på Mi2 Cardinal juni-17: klar lys strågul med flott skum som varer. Honning, blomstereng, pepper, stall og høy. Mild bitterhet i ettersmaken. Slank og meget lettdrikkelig - en av kveldens absolutte höjdare.

Shared bottle at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours hazy light golden with white head. Aroma of citrus, light bread, pepper. Tastes sweet with little bitterness and some fruity sourness. Thin bodied, slightly sweet finish.

Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 05.06.17. Pale straw colour, almost clear. Fine white head and lacing. Fruity aroma of Continental hops, meadows and white pepper. Similar taste. Dry. High carbonation. Good drinkabilty.

Shared bottle at Cardinal. Pours almost clear weak golden with a huge frothy white head. Aroma of skunky hops, weak farmhouse and funk. Taste is moderate sweet, fruity and lively mouthfeel, with spicy notes at the finish, sweet herbal finish,nice
Aromas nice with a little bit of funk yeast malt spice. Both body and flavor are a little bit thin.

75cl-fles gekregen van Davide. Merci! U: Helder goudblond met een witte schuimkraag. G: Bleekmout, esters en honing. S: Moutzoet. Licht metallisch, honing en licht fruitig. M: Medium body met medium carbonatie.
Aroma afruitado. En un primer momento dulce, despues seca. Club de Cata Olut
Bottle at Olut Sabadell. Golden, medium carbonation. White head. Dry. Medium to full body. Malty and soft bitter.
Cerveza aromatica con presencia de cereal. En boca sorprende el poco dulzor y la presencia de amargor de los lupulos. Elegante. Tasted in Olut club de cata
aroma muy agradable a lúpulo y un toque a frutado muy suave, un gusto dulce que termina de golpe

Bu sur place à la Brasserie du baron (Gussignies).
Verre de 37 cl issu dune bouteille de 75 cl.
Couleur dorée , assez trouble avec du dépôt apparent .
Col de mousse epaix et bien abondant.
Bien gazeux co2 bien présent .
Au nez : présence de levure , note de frais legèrement floral , un peu de sucre .
En bouche : présence deau , houblonée et sensation de frais en bouche .
note floral . fin de bouche sur le houblon mais plutôt leger .
une fin longue et moelleux .
une bière de garde plutôt simple , mais bien faite !

Ckear golden orange pour with a thick and creamy white head...excellent retention and lacing. Aroma is very soft...light tropical fruits, touch of sweetness, faint clovey/coriandery spice, leather, minerals. Flavor follows suit...adds pepper and earthy bitterness...less sweetness than the nose. Mouthfeel is light and silky/lively with a dry earthy/leathery bitter finish. So damn good!

750ml bottle at home. 16th December 16. Pours light straw colour. Aroma is floral, yeast, sweet, grass. Taste is floral, sweet, light bitter hops, fresh grass, yeast. Lovely, reminds me of the new style hoppy Belgian pale ales.
Cerveza muy disfrutable. Probada en botella de 75. Cuerpo medio, muy aromática pan, flores, fruta y levadura

Densa con espuma duradera aunque no muy compacta. En nariz es una fiesta de esteres de levadura y aromas a Malta . Manzana, almendra, banana, pera, pan recién horneado, flores. El Paso por boca es limpio con carbonatacion viva. No se nota el alcohol. Rica rica

Bottle 750ml. corked. [ As Au Baron Cuvee des Jonquilles Blonde ].Clear medium yellow orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is light moderate malty, wheat - pale malt, moderate yeasty, saison yeast, belgium yeast, floral - vegetables. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, grass - floral - yeast bitter, saison yeast, belgium yeast, candy yeast. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161018]
Bottle @ Johns. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, yeast, light grain, hay. Flavor is light sweet, malt, yeasty, grain, hay-ish hops. Thin to medium body, lively carbonation. 181016
Bottle, 7%. Clear golden with medium white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, spices, hop, grass and a little floral. Flavour is malt, yeast, spices, medium sweet, grass, little floral and a little bitter.

Bottle @ Aarhus tasting. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity, light yeasty and light hoppy - grass. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 181016
Bottle @ Aarhus tasting, my place. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, sweet fruits, hops, flowers and malt. Sweet light bitter finish.

Taste this more times, last end febr. 2016 @ home from 75 cl.
Hazy darkgolden color, with a white head. 
Aroma: little spice, fruits, sweet. Medium body.
Taste: sweet start, some spice, fruits, very regular blonde with hopsbitterness.
Leicht trübes goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, leicht fruchtig, blumig, getreidig, etwas pfeffrig, sehr süffig.

opalescent golden colour, moderate sized off-white head; aroma of overripe fruits, hay, earthy, leather, minimal floral and barnyard notes, some breadcrust and hints of citruses; taste of overripe fruits, hints of honey, caramel and earthy notes; good one
Excellente bière, beaucoup de goût, et en même temps très équilibrée. Létiquette ne paie pas de mine mais elle vaut le coup !
75cl bottle. Appearance is light hazy gold to orange. Thin persistent white head. Taste is is light sour, light sweet. Aroma is fruit, caramel, yeast, spices.

750 ml corked & caged green bottle, as Au Baron Cuvée des Jonquilles Blonde, from Vinmonopolet, Nettbutikken. ABV is 7%. Very pale golden colour, huge white head. Very nice fruity and spicy aroma. Slightly sweet, fruity and lightly spicy flavour, easy drinking and quite enjoyable, but a little more bittering hops would not hurt.
Bottle @ Au Baron, Gussignies. Hazy amber colour, lots of particles in the beer. Banana, herbs, malty. Light sweet, light bitter finish. Nice Biere de Garde.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden body with a medium white top. Aroma is estery and fruity. Some spice, coriander and hints of bananas. Taste is light sweet and dry. Some yeasty fruityness along with notes of clove. Quite nice. Medium body and co2.

Big white head doesnt last. Hazy deep yellow body with carbonation. Fruity spicy teak wood aroma with herbal lacquer aroma. Very unusual. Dryish fruity spicy mealy taste with herbal toffee notes. Mid-bodied. Mild, mealy mouthfeel. Dryish lemony fruity spicy aftertaste with herbal, caraway flower notes. Very elegant and unusual beer. I really like it. Highly drinkable. (0.75l bottle, from wine monopoly, Storo, Oslo.)

A dining room rate, the first in some time. 
Pours a hazy yellow with a big head and spotty lacing on the glass.


The aroma is lightly earthy with wet limestone, some herbal character, and a lot of fresh baked white bread.

The flavor is quite pleasant, there is a mild floral bitterness throughout with a soft baguette like maltiness and a bit of earthy minerality. Its quite dry and has just a touch of lemony character. Well rounded and spicy at times without ever entering the "clove" realm. 

This is lovely, I hope that Ill get to try it a bit fresher someday.

Bottle, 75cl corked. Almost clear in the glass, pale golden in color, and topped by a dense, white, finger-thick head. Flowers, pale malts, hints of white sugar, some banana and a generic fruityness in the aroma. Medium body with a soft carbonation. Decent bitterness and a mostly fruity flavor with some flowers, banana and white sugar. Rather dry though, its not on the sweet side. Lasting fruity finish. A tasteful and quite refreshing one, interesting too. 160102

Bottle at Café Sara, august 11th 2015. Hazy deep golden body with a lasting white head. Aroma is fruity with grass, light spicy from the yeast. Bitter and dry taste, herbal and peppery, with a subtle funky end. Crisp and fruity aftertaste. Very pleasant stuff.
Bottle 75cl. Medium white head. Fizzy. Color is a bit hazy, light yellow and peach. Aroma is butter, flowers, banana. Taste is sweet with esters, butter.
Bouteille 75 cl - couleur or trouble, au nez cest floral, très rafraîchissante, goût herbacé, fruit exotique, une bonne surprise
KRS/KØLF 020116. Golden-yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is spices, yeast, wheat, banana. Flavour is spices, wheat, yeast, malt, citrus, banana, coriander, fruit. OK beer.

Bottle, SX Bottle Share

Great conditioning for the style. Prominent white lacing. Hazy. Smells of wild flowers, dandelions, morning garden dew. Taste is white wine grapes, lemons, soft malts, a dry but pleasing finish. Really spritzy and zingy. A great Bierre de Garde. Top work.

Bottle shared at home. Big gusher so half the bottle lost on the floor. Slight hazy golden with short lasting off white head. Quite sweet malty notes, some honey and flowers, light lemon, lots of light spicy yeast with some white pepper, nice farmyard character. Medium sweet and very light bitter and sour. Medium bodied with slick feel and a bit soft but fizzy carbonation. Nice.

one yellow and pale orange light haze .. Good crown d white spongy foam with good retention and active carbonation. Lacing remains are abundant and well-defined inside the cup. Very aromatic, with the presence of yeast, sweet and sour citrus notes (candied orange) and sweet fruit like pear, banana and Paraguay. Against a background of honey and caramel float also other shades of earthy, floral and medicinal character that add complexity.
In the mouth firm, flavorful, with sweet and fruity notes entry and more acidic, dry and astringent. Very well balanced with earthy and smooth bitter finish point. Flavor with hints of pear, banana and orange marmalade. Medium bodied and lively carbonation. Easy to drink tight style

Bottle 750ml @ Gunnfryd 50th birthday tasting
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, banana, floral and fruity. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long yeasty, banana and floral finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Robe blonde, mousse, peu abondante. Nez frais sur des notes de houblon, de foin, de fruits jaunes, sur un fond minéral. Bouche tout en tension, bulle fine, finale tendue et sèche. Une bière de soif, qui désaltère après le ski.

750 ml bottle. Slightly foggy, pale golden body with a small white head. Aroma is spicy with yeast, wheat, some banana and maybe coriander. Dangerously light and refreshing in flavor, mild pale malt, wheat, spices, yeast and fruit. Medium to light bodied and refreshing in aftertaste as well with a floral ending. Might not be exactly in accordance with style, but I sure enjoyed this one.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow orange with thick frothy white head and large yeast chunks. The aroma is strong yeast, floral, citrus. Medium mouth, similar flavors to nose, light finish, very good.

Bottle. Pours pale straw yellow with a white head. Aroma of fruitiness, some herbs, malt and yeast. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some citrus, malt, some floral notes and herbs. Medium body, average carbonation.

bottle if i am correct .. . gritty mouth feel .. hazy gold farm .. cereal husks, yeast, sweet yeast, flower petals, and mushed daisies .. . airy finish, its a biere de garde so.. .. . so the baby might be born covered in thumbtacks and ant bites. I guess youd just have to be careful..

0,75 bottle. Pours golden, hazy, with large white head. Aromas of spices, yeasts, some phenolic notes. Taste is slightly bitter, spicy, fruity, with somewhat alcoholic aftertaste when beer gets warmer. Light to medium bodied, with fizzy carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a hazy deep golden body with a medium white head, disappearing fast. Aroma is gooseberries, citrus, pale malts, wheat and hints of straw, red fruits and banana. Taste is white sugar, estery banana tones, straw, pale malts and hints of wheat, citrus and floral honey notes. Medium body, high to fizzy carbonation. Not too shabby, but this is not the kind of BdG I enjoy most. Too fizzy, too saison-oriented and not enough malt complexity. Still drinkable enough.

Hazy golden with a shallow fluffy head. Aroma is belgian yeast, apples, malty, some light saison-like barnyard. Medium sweet with a drier finish, low bitterness. Medium carbonation, thin body, almost watery. Simple and refreshing, but overall disappointing.

Bottle at home. Has a slightly hazy straw color with a small off-white head. Fresh aroma of lemon, pale malt, Belgian yeast and dry head. Flavor of spices, alcohol and perfume. Has a slick mouth feel, medium body, and a light bitterness. A fresh beer but has a bit unbalanced taste. Decent.
WOW! What a POP. Clear to hazy yellow color with medium head that disappears quite fast. Flavor is yeast and fruity. Flavor is malt, sole hops, quite heavy.

Hazy gold 1 finger head. Sticky head. Great malt quality aroma wheat grist, honey, oats and European chewy pine hops. Excellent mouthfeel. Crisp, honey sweetness. Malts and hops linger. Had a blaugies yeast profile. The oat quality is great. Overall, a solid beer

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 Flaska från Saveur Bieré. Smak och doft av belgisk jäst, humle, päron, citron, örter, hö med toner av grön banan, honung, jord och svaga toner karamell. Lagom sötma, friskt och fruktig, en aning blommig och torr smak, fin beska. Rund och len och en fröjd för gommen! Mycket gott!
-Day after thoughts- Bread,Belgian yeast, citrus and floral Sweet, crisp and floral finish. Overall: Very enjoyable.

On botte from Vinmonopolet Sandefjord July 2015. SLightly hazy pale golden color with some foam. Mediuam aroma intensity; floral and fruity aromas dominate, some malt and light honey. Medium body & complexity. Some bitterness- subtle and well balanced beer. Enjoyable

750ml bottle from Wine Club. Bought on Nolens recommendation and more proof that we should listen to him. Cork almost came out on its own when the cage was removed, but surprisingly not a gusher. Pour is clear golden, large creamy white head that dissipates slowly leaving nice lacing. Aroma is grains, herbal, very floral, honey biscuit, some dust. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, floral and biscuit malts, light honey note, fairly fruity. Medium body, soft carbonation. This beer really grows on you with time. Highly enjoyable.

[My bottle (750ml) shared with GregClow, jercraigs & mabel] Pours a hazy gold with an average size diminishing frothy white head. No lacing. Aroma is yeasty, floral, citrusy and bready. Yeasty & grassy flavour along with floral, bready and fruity notes. Lightly bitter finish. Average bodied. Really good.

[7431-20150730] 750mL bottle. Mildly smoked floral yeast aroma with a light plant note. Slightly hazy, pale yellow tan body with a quick foamy white head. Bitter lemon yeast and planty smoked grass notes in the flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/4/7/3/15) 3.6
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, GregClow, jercraigs)
Overheard: "Whats this supposed to be, hits of the 80s?" "More like shxts of the 80s."

2015-07-30. Hazy pastel yellow body with a decent white head that fades a bit. 3+ Aroma is lightly yeasty, with mild floral and grassy touches. Flavour is similar, mild yeast, light grassy florals, sweet pale malt and sweet lemon, notes of wheat maybe? Very smooth average plus bodied palate, soft effervescent carbonation. 3+ Pleasant but relatively restrained overall. Bottle shared by Blankboy.

750, corked and baled. Pours a cloudy dark gold with a dense white head that settles. Loose stringy lace. Bright sweet vrassy nose, clean and approachable. Creamy light-medium body with effervescent carb. Caramel, chamomile, grass, and hay on the mid palate. Long mild grassy finish. So nice.

From 0,75l bottle, Pours: deep cloudy straw yellow liquid, small white frothy head, Aroma: floral, elderflower, pears, plums, Taste: medium sweet, light to medium bitter, light to medium sour, fruity, pear, spicy, citrus, light alcohol, Palate: light body, lively carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long sour sweet finish, Overall: enjoyed, perfect beer.
Bottle. Yellow hazy colour, white head. Aroma elderflower, fruity, grapes, herbal, yeast. Fresh aroma. Taste spicy, fruity, bit alcohol although light body. Not bad. Quite high carbonation. Not bad.
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2015 Bottle.Hazy yellow color with medium white head. Malr, lemon, spices on aroma. Taste, malt, spices, lemon, yeast.
Bottle. Aroma saisony, barnyard, cheesy, lemony. Hazy yellow colour. Taste is quite smooth among saisons (?), slightly alcoholic, spicy, lemony. Good one. Easily drinkable, highly carbonated.

Light bronze body with a cloud-like foam top. Grassy and spring nose and body. Revivifying. Earthy and intensely grassy finish. One of the most enjoyable Biere de Gardes Ive enjoyed to date despite the modest rating. Bring this one along on a picnic.

750ml bottle. Beautiful hazy blonde with whipped white foam. Aroma is quite grassy with malty orchard fruit notes. Taste is bright citrus fruits, especially lemon. Slightly herbal and grassy. Faint yeastiness. There is a slight tartness but this is mostly dry. Was pleasantly surprised with how good this was.

Bottle from VP Aker Brygge enjoyed at home
Yellow hazy, big white head. Smell of ripe fruits, melon, banana, mango, hints of peach, spices. alot of yeast esters, light malts. Moderate sweet, tons of fruity flavors similar to the aroma, spicy, nice and refreshing. Moderate bitter finish. A nice BdG
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Noe uklar gul farge. Moderat karbonert med tynn skumtopp som forsvinner. Smaker høy, banan, nellik,gjær.Fruktig. Ganske god
Bottle. Overall positive. Refreshing, well balanced aroma, great taste, pleasant finish.

This 75 cl bottle at the Kerelshof in Cassel. Disappointingly bland, which may be following the St Omer Castelain trend to tedious or may be a flaw - an odd sticking plaster backtaste was in there somewhere. Apologies to the brewer if I have judged it on a rogue bottle.
Dimmig gulorange öl med vitt äggviteskum. Doft och smak av citrus, jäst och lätt pepprighet.

Lukt: Høy og gjær
Utseende: Lys gulfarge.
Skum/kullsyre: Tynt skum, noe karbonering.
Smak: Frisk høy, noe syrlig avslutning.

Gelb, trüb. Leicht würzig, hefig, süßlich. Am Gaumen Süße, leicht herb, hefig, weizig, etwas seifig, Heu. BReiter Körper.

UPDATED: JUL 17, 2016 Bottle , 75cL. @Espéraza, with Cyril. A pale yellow opaque fizzy beer with a big white foamy head ; medium retention, lacing. Herb, flower, light lemon ; "noble" aroma. Alcohol touch when temperature gets higher. Light sweet, medium dry bitter refreshing, light warming. Medium body, thin silky texture, average good carbonation, herbal light fruity refreshing finish. Overall, a really good herbal fruity french ale ; "elegant" character.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2016 Si presenta con un colore giallo paglierino molto pallido e velato, con una schiuma bianca fine, normale e non troppo persistente. Al naso le note del lievito sono preponderanti, con bei sentori floreali e lievemente speziati (coriandolo), oltre che con sentori di pane fragrante e di lievissimo agrumato (cedro). Al palato il corpo è watery, con una carbonazione non eccessiva ma che nasconde bene i suoi 7 gradi alcolici. Al gusto però è carente, con lievi sentori zesty e speziati, seguiti da note erbacee con un finale poco amaro. Sorso secco senza persistenza ma che lascia il palato pulito, con un po di salinità finale.

0.75L bottle from French e-shop

Hazy yellow to golden with very light orange tinge. Head is an evidence of wheat, medium lasting, white colored. Aroma is light phenolic spiciness, light herbal hoppiness, honey tones, light colored malts, candy, very balanced! Taste is sweet fruity, lemony, tartness from CO2, taste similar to aroma, very good! Light dryness, medium to hight carbonation. Amazingly balanced and complex. Reminds me a bit of a sweeter version of a good Saison.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 750ml bottle. Slightl cloudy, golden colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Slightly grainy and strawy aroma with a cautious fruity touch, hints of apricot, peach and some peppery yeast spiciness. Taste is mellow fruity, notes of apricot, mirabelle and peach, minimally dry, dusty, yeasty overtones. Soft, gentle, nice.

Blonde doree palichonne, gross carbo, collet epais et persistant.
Aromes citronnés et fleuris, grosse presence levures.
Un peu acide en attaque, elle sadoucit par la suite. Présence peu marque de saveurs (un peu de citron). Assez courte. petite note de miel en finale
Malgres ces quelques defauts relativement agreable

Nez peu malté mais qui exprime bien la levure surabondante dans cette bière. Attaque en bouche citronnée agréable. Puis, terminé, la bière devient vite fade et trés lourde. Le fond de la bouteille nest que levure.
Pour moi, cette bière est brassée beaucoup trop rapidement , elle est sans équilibre, juste bonne pour un verre lété mais alors bien fraîche, car réchauffée, elle ne tient pas du tout.
Quant à la mousse, elle seffondre très vite. A oublier comme bière de garde. Il en existe de bien meilleures dans sa région, La Bavaisienne ou la Cuivrée de Mormal par exemple de chez Theillier.
Pours a golden body with cloudy haze and white lacing. Aroma is spicy, banana, light fruit and wheat. Mouthfeel is medium with notes of banana, sweet malt..

Pours lightly hazy golden yellow with a white head. The aroma has overripe fruit, cellar must, light citrus, rich smoothness, BdG thick yeastiness, light spice and some cobwebs. It has a medium smooth rich body with lots of frothy carbonation. The flavor starts with caramel, ripe fruit, cellar must, rich malt and some spiciness. The finish has more spice and some sulfur. Really well made biere de garde.

Bottle @ THT December. Pours a clear golden beer with a bright white head on top. Aroma of soap, perfume, flowery hops and some light yeasts. Flavor is sweet, loads of perfume in there again, soapy. Aftertaste is sweet and light. Decent enough.
Poured light golden with a small off white ring. Aroma of light saison yeast and soft malt. Medium body, flavour of the aroma, lightly sweet, lightly bitter.
Très bonne nordiste, jolie blonde pâle, légèrement troublée, bonne amertume, a beaucoup moussé, ai beaucoup aimé. Bouteille achetée chez La cave à bulles, Paris, France, bue le 14/07/2013.
One of the best gardes so far. Fresh and fruity with a nice touch of hops and some vanilla. Easily drinkable, full body - good one.

Bottle from trade with Calisky - many thanks! The beer pours out in a hazy golden-amber colour with steady head and medium body. Aroma of fruity hops and wheat. Taste of hops, mild fruits, straw, hay, light Belgian yeast, wheat and bread. Easy drinkable, very quaffable. Enjoyed it.
Great beer. Spicy, elegant, very well rounded with straw hints and a point of sweetness that enhances a surprisingly solid balance. Perfect for fish dishes.

Amarelo ouro com espuma de boa formação e persistência. Aroma cítrico, biscoito, malte. No sabor, frutas amarelas, biscoito, malte com um pouco de acidez e médio amargor. Final seco e um pouco adstringente. Refrescante. Muito boa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle at home with friends. Pour is slightly hazy golden with a big white head and decent lacing. Yeasty, husky, grassy, some biscuit, somewhat floral, minerally, lightly chalky, and straw in the aroma. Taste is sweet malty, some straw, lemon, grassy, some pepper, basil, light herbs, and husky with a dry finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Easy drinker.

"Spice, funk, citrus and herbs greet the nose and palate. Pretty nice, though the dusty aroma isnt something im a big fan of and it also mutes the otherwise pleasant flavor as well. Quite carbonated and prickly. ok overall."
Bottle shared by Dan. Nose is weird like a shitty Mexican lager. Weird funk to it too. Taste is barely funky. Watery. Ok.
Funky, sweet, spicy, minty?, corn, almost like malt likka. Clearish pale yellow color white head, like malt likka. Taste is of funky malt likka, adjuncts, corn,...hmm.
Bottleshare thanks to dan. Pours clear with white head. Aroma is still corona and corn. Malt likka? Taste is light, still get corn.
Couleur dorée-orange trouble, bonne mousse blanche. Nez de houblon fruité, note agrumes. Gout levures belges, malt doux sucré, houblon frais. Fin un notes dagrumes.

Typical, commissioned bière de garde that won a bronze medal on a contest for French regional products. The beer itself had a cloudy ochre blonde colour and an aroma of green apple, dried apricot, pineapple, melon, lemon peel, lavender, soap, bark, ginger... Golden peach in color. Fat, rocky white head clings to the glass after each gulp. Lovely perfumey nose of potpourri, cracker dough, honey-drizzled hay, lemon balm, apricot, cotton candy, and spicy, anise-tinged hops. Plenty of minerals, musty cellar and peppery phenols, as well. Expansive carbonation. Dry crackery malt initially accompanies the airy, well-attenuated body which paves the way for slicker honeydew and a quenching lemony twang interlaced with a succulent floral hop burst. Intricate yeast-derived nuances deliver solid depth. Dry as a bone, yet far from stark or hollow, as dabs of cotton candy gel with a twist of juicy hops and bright fruity esters to fill out the bodys core. Apricot and pineapple aplenty, along with a pillowy banana cream pie effect from the yeast and piecrusty malt. Well-textured malt also aids the body with its palate-hugging starches. Finishes soft and dry with a beautifully balanced interplay of juicy, lightly herbal hops, brawny yet clean Pils malt, and musty yeast. Hugely appetizing afterimage of gently warming alcohol and peppery phenols. The predominant character of musty cellar draws instant parallels to Castelain Blond Biere and Bière des Sans Culottes, though  this exhibits considerably more depth and less hollowness than those examples. I must say this is very saisonlike in its complex ester and phenol profile, zippy hoppiness, and subtle tartness. Either way a thoroughly enjoyable contemplative quaffer!

UPDATED: JUL 15, 2011 smells light kinda like hay and sweet fruit. looks nice and hazy lots of chunks though. got high expectations! Taste isnt quite as good smell taste is kinda ok more belgian strong ale than anything else. mouthfeel is really good though
Poured hazy orange with nice head tasted nice and light, fruitty and refreshing goos saison and beer

Pour is opaque deep yellow with a big fizzy off white head...smell is very farmy; horseblanket, musty, and toasty...lots of straw and bread dough...very lively mouthfeel, almost too effervescent...relatively light flavors...some faint citrus and toasty malt flavors...medium sweetness with just too much effervescence...the sharp carbonation doesnt completely cut the sweetness in the finish either...good none the less...

Bottle - 750mL corked and caged. Hazy golden pour with a small, bubbly white head. Aroma is grains, straw, yeast, soft fruit notes and earth. Taste is much sweeter than the aroma let on. Sweet malt, slightly under-ripe fruit, floral notes, straw, grass, cereal grains, dusty yeast and soft earthy notes. Body is light-medium and strongly carbonated, though not quite to the level of champagne. Finishes with more sweet malt, fruit notes, dusty yeast, grains, straw, light earthy flavors, and hints of sponge cake.

750 ml corked and caged green bottle poured a hazy yellow with a lingering ring of white foam. Aromas of bread, yeast and light floral notes. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a smooth dry finish. Flavors of straw, vanilla, yeast, light citrus and light floral notes with a smooth dry citrus finish.

Appearance:  hazy, creamy gold with a huge frothy white head that leaves good lacing.  Aroma: 	a little funky, a little herbal, with notes of hay and grass and a tiny note of sweat socks and sewer.  Taste: bready, with a good dose of fruit (pears, citrus, white grape) and spice (pepper) and grassy hop notes and sweetish yeast.   Finish: a little tangy and sweet, with lingering notes of white bread, drying nicely.  Notes:   Bottle from Rare Beer Club. 	An extremely drinkable beer.  Paired perfectly with Dover sole and a garden vegetable risotto.  Palate was chewy yet light, with good creamy carbonation.

750 ml bottle corked & caged, opened with force once the wire was removed but did not gush.  Sweet and spicy on the nose with hints of fennel.  Pours a hazy blonde with lively carbonation and thick head that dissipates quickly.  Very light with a floral maltiness with a sweetness upfront with spices like fennel, white pepper, and coriander.  Extremely drinkable with dry finish.   Excellent.

Bottled, thin orange juice color with soapy white foam, sweet. 
Herbal, aroma with flavor of watered down orange juice and dandelions
Shared with Travlr (see review below). This farmhouse is nice but simple: some spice notes -- cardamom, but not overpowering. Nice yeast notes come through -- bready. Quite effervescent, white head.
Bottle courtesy of Kevin, thank you sir!  Cloudy light golden color, large white head.  Aroma of straw, hay, some barnyard, rising bread dough.  Taste is malty hay.  Plain.

bottle from Village de la Bière. Hazy golden colour, mid-sized, persistent head. Wild sourish nose. Rather light-bodied, Spicy, peppery, wild sourish flavours given a punch with a fierce carbonation. Elements of Gueuze and Bière de garde mixed here, very interesting. Grainy background, dusty, woody hops (in a pleasant way) are also present. A complex and very interesting and unusual beer. A wild bière de garde!
14th June 2009Hazy gold beer. Softish palate. Clean malt. Very light., almost creamy. Very light fruity undertone. Nice finish, not too dry. Nice joined up and refreshing.

750mL Bottle, purchased at Conn Ave Liquors - Washington, DC. Aroma of nice bready and spicey Belgian yeast. This has awesome traditional 
character, but is definitely on the pale side of the style. Very saison-like. 
Wonderful pale fruit flavors, good body, softness and light balanced 
sweetness. A pleasant, soothing flavor that is immediately reminiscent of 
spring. Delectable.

Bottle from Sams in Durham.  Pours a darker golden with orange and brown hues.  Hazy, and with an extremely lively, huge white head.  Not over-carbonated, though.  Nose of delicate malts, bread, dry yeast, floral and earthy hints, some hay/barnyard notes.  Similar taste, those with an added honey sweetness.  Id think it were too sweet if it didnt finish so nicely dry.  As many others have noted, this has one foot in saison and the other in beire de garde... and its say it has the balance just right.

Bottle.

Head is initially large, frothy, white, fully lasting.
Body is dark yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (flowers, apricot), with light notes of honey, celery, gum, pepper, cat pee.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation, lightly to moderately alcoholic.

Not a lot of aroma, and some aspects of it are unpleasant...there are nice things going on too, but ultimately its hard to get around the vegetal and urine-like notes.  The flavor balance and mouthfeel are ok. Overall just meh.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2014 effervescent and bright citrus, dandelion, melon, banana and perfume nose.  medium body made lighter by crisp carbonation and mild acid.  bubble gum, melon and lemon are featured up front, with moderately chewy belgian pale malt and candy sugar, finished by a bright and lustrous noble hop acid washing.

Bottle. Listed as Au Baron Brasserie (Gussignies, France) Cuvee des Jonquilles Biere de Garde (7%). Rating is from a practice BJCP Scoresheet. I was scoring it in the biere de garde category (16D). The numbers in this rating reflect ratebeers hedonistic scale and not my judging numbers. 
Aroma: Grassy, toasty, lightly herbal and peppery with some clove notes. A bit musty, candied ginger, toasty malt aromas. Leans a bit more to the spicy yeast character exhibited by saisons. Complex and delicate interaction of yeast and malt with moderate esters. 
Flavor: Bready, malty, toasty, light musty character with faint esters. Grassy and spicy (attributable to both the hops and pils malt) in the finish. Hops character is low as is the bitterness. Lingering balance of fermentation character and malt complexities. Light pear and other fruit notes linger. Nice crispness. Quite dry with a noticeable farmhouse fermentation character. 
Mouthfeel: Very high and lively carbonation (nearly harshly so), very light warmth. Dry on the finish. Strong carbonic bite. No astringencies. Like a good farmhouse ale it feels refreshing and vibrant. 
Overall Impression: A very good farmhouse ale that treads the lines between a saison and a biere de garde. Nice, vibrant and refreshing with strong fermentation characters (lightly estery, lightly phenolic, lightly musty). Could do with a slightly more pronounced malt character to fit better into the BdG category. A very well crafted beer.

(750ml bottle from provisions store).  Pours hazy yellow with white head.  Aroma has skunkiness (damnit!), belgian yeast, florals, and herbs.   Taste is sweet with spiciness on the tip of the tongue.  Medium bodied with an almost creamy texture.  Finish is smooth.  Too bad its skunked. I guess Ill have to get a good bottle in France where they dont skunk their bottles.  Fuckers.
From a bottle poured an amber color with a fair amount of head.  Nice spicy malty flavor with a quick finish.
Bottle purchased in Paris.  Cloudy golden orange pour, white head.  Fruit, earthy, herbal hops, and some bready malts.  A nice saison, but far to sweet for my liking of this style.
Lovely farm aroma like Saison Dupont. The palate is sofer and less acidic than Dupont. After a few minutes the head has gone completely and the taste has become more sickly.

Bottle 75 cl from the brewery. Golden blonde, slightly hazy, pretty light foam. Aromas of fruity malted, bread and yeast. The taste is fairly full-bodied, spiced and fine, keys of lemon and apricot. Bitterness correct. Beer joke between two kinds, garde and saison, but interesting.

Corked bottle from La Cave A Bulles.Pours a cloudy cheddar orange with a thick, frothy white head.  Aroma is plastic and copper hay.  Flavor is sweet and floral butter with a hint of grapefruit.  Average mouthfeel.  Clean and very enjoyable.
user_location: Ugly, Hot, and Humid Spring, Texas, USA

text: Apricot pour. Complex fruity nose. Farmhouse earthy barnyard taste. Pleasant. A hint of star anise in the finish. Rated 4/14/10

750ml Bottle (Cork popped with a loud bang):  Aroma of yeast and some doughy bread.  Poured amber/orange/gold in color with a small, fizzy, white head that disappeared quickly but lasted around the edges.  Cloudy.  Sparkling.  Full of tiny, small, medium, and large-sized particles throughout.  Flavor is medium sweet.  Tastes of yeast, slight malts, and a hint of hops.  Light to medium body.  Tingly, then slightly dry texture.  Carbonation is fizzy and lively.  Sweet, yeast finish.  Kinda boring.  Just lots of yeast.

Bottle. Big POP as the cork fires into the ceiling and the beer starts to flow. Dark yellow with a thick merangue white head. Earth, grass and barn aroma. Flavour starts where the aroma ends. Creamy milky body. Taste of earth, straw, banana cream, barn and soft spice.
Bottle.  Pours  a hazy golden with a large white head.  Spicy yeast, citrus, grass, floral and dusty.  Bread y with earth and a drying finish.  Good.
Bottle au Baron, at the brewery. Very floral hoppy aroma. Citrusfruits, refreshing, well balanced. Good.

Bottle au Baron, at the brewery.
Very floral hoppy aroma. Citrusfruits, refreshing, well balanced. Good.

A huge pop upon the opening surprises for what seems to be a rather old beer. The musty, lightly oxidized aroma also hints at dryness to come and delicate spicy yeastiness, so much that beyond the negative first impression, we are quickly won. An old treasure lies beyond those cobwebs. Very herbal and most of all, incredibly put together hops. Delicious hallertauer, done perfectly - spot on as I like them with a floweriness you want to suck on, a glass you could never tire of all paired with that musty yeast. This is between burgerbraus wolnzacher hell in top shape and de rankes guldenberg or a softened xx bitter. Spotty powderiness, likely from the lack of freshness and a redundant grainy maltiness are the only factors to keep it away from a 10, and this was done mostly on hops alone. Medium bodied, very soft carbonation. It may not be in top shape, but itll make you feel young, as you rediscover the pleasures which first brought you into good beer.
Bottled. Apparently I drank this with skortila and Bullit, but I did not take notes. But I know I had about the same opinion about the beer as they had :P. Anyways, for a French beer, its quite ok.

Bottled. Aroma has yeast, floral hops, is a bit citric and has some spice. Hazy, yellow coloured with a white head. The taste is a bit sweet, has citrus. Some yeast, floral hops as well present. Light-medium bodied. Refreshing.
Bottle @ Skortila. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of sour dough, flower and spices. Flavour of sweet malts, some spices.

In short: A somewhat wild/barnyard beer with a over-the-top floral character. Very original and quite delicious. How: Bottle 750ml, 2 ½ year old bottle. Tasting session with Montreal crew. The look: Cloudy dirty yellow body topped by a medium white head In long: Nose is very floral with dandelions, mint and a bunch of wild and garden flowers. Barnyard character present in the aroma and taste. Taste has the same floral character but is also very sharp with a medium astringency and acidity. Pineapples, citrus and lemon join in the party. Despite the age of the bottle (over 2 years old) I had the feeling that what I was tasting was exactly the intended result. A truly original beer unlike anything youve had before. Unless you had a Cuvée des Jonquilles before, in which case it is a truly original beer just like something youve had before.

Bouteille verte, avec bouchon de liège, de 750 ml partagée lors dune dégustation Ratebeer Montréal chez MartinT. Arôme: Odeur floral avec une pointe dépices. Apparence: La couleur est blonde voilée. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Légère présence dépices et de miel avec une pointe de lavande. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement huileuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Arrière goût légèrement sucré. (Rating #2051)

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2012 My Bottom Line:
Dandelion-like floral character emanates from the marriage of doughy yeast and spicy hops, while seemingly barnyard-malted cereals fluff this Bière de Gardes already cushiony mouthfeel.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the hazy straw blond.
-Spicy hop bitterness is delicate and surrounded by the earthy yeast character.
-A subtle fruitiness dabbles within the tropical territory (bananas, citrus).
-This might be in the same range of authenticity as Blaugies Saisons.
-The best before date is clearly too early. This can age at least a year or two after this date, if we rely on this batch of course.
-This smells like countryside. It just does.


Bottles.

750 ml bottle from Cave a Bulles.  Hazy pale golden yellow beer with a creamy white head.  Very highly carbonated with a cork that shot straight out like a bullet.  Lovely looking beer with a thick white head and an equally appealing aroma.  Softly crackery with a soft fresh fruitiness.  Some light apricot and a touch of dank cellery character.  Just a kiss of light spiciness and citrus with a soft herbal note.  Warming the spicy/herbal notes really pick up and the beer comes into its own.  This could easily pass for a saison and a damn fine one at that.  Very perfumey aroma that invites continuing contemplation.

Corked bottle, from La Cave à Bulles, ParisAs soon as the metallic cage is removed, the cork explodes, luckily only directed to the ceiling, and even after pouring one glass, the foam keeps floating out of the bottle.In the glass there is a hazy blond colored beer, with a big head, quite thick; also the perlage is persistent. Nice aroma, dry and spicy, with a touch of citrus, like a Saison. The body is medium-thin, even if the carbonation is almost gone in the explosion; it has a lean flavor, with the Saison-like spices, but lacking on body, more flavor and bitterness. Refreshing, good, but could be better.

Poured, after foaming out of the bottle,  a hazy light gold with a large white head.  The aroma was pretty floral with a light spice and light sweetness.  The flavor had a biscuity malt mixed with more floral and spiced notes.  The beer dries out quickly but doesnt get too dry.  Lively mouthfeel on a light to medium body.

750mL cork&cage bottle, I am pretty sure this is a few years old, no date.  The cork shot out like a cannonball.  The beer pours a thick golden color with no clarity at all and a small head. Aroma is full of flowers and rose-like sweetness.  Juts a bit of barnyard as well.  Taste is less sweet and less floral, more straight Bière de Garde with a white bread maltiness.  A slightly above average carbonation and a nice full body make it very smooth and felt on the cheeks.  A very nice brew.
user_location: HdG (past: NYC, KS, Rain City), Maryland, USA

text: Shared by beastiefan2k - man, the cork sure rocketed out of this one (I think Ive yet to find where is landed last night) cloudy golden, fizzy-bodied beer - floral aroma, with notes of wildflower honey (it smells like a field in springtime - melodramatic, I know, but its kind of true) - despite the carbonation, the beer is quite soft - very floral, with lavender being the most prominent - moderately dry, with just a touch of honey sweetness to keep it from being too much so - very subdued and pleasant.

750 mL bottle, courtesy SoLan.  Cloudy straw color with a thin broken head.  Clean, mild flowery-sweet aroma with a corny graininess.  Some yeast on the nose too.  Moderately thick palate, a little chalky.  Sweet grainy flavor with a significant yeat component.  Finish is sweet and a little herbal with some fruit as well.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a cloudy golden body with a large white head. Aroma of floral, barnyard, mustiness, and lemon grass.  Flavor of spicy yeast, floral hops, earthiness, and caramel with a soft, but nicely carbonated mouthfeel that finishes dry.

This is indeed a lively ale. The cork hit the ceiling and I had to quickly catch the foam oozing from the bottle. Once it settled down, this golden ale poured with a fluffy white head, elciting a sharp yeast aroma. The flavor is tart and bread-like, with various spices and a long bitter finish. Very drinkable.

Bottled. Pours out in a hazy golden colour with a rich lively white foam. Yeasty, bready and rather funky aroma of mild lemon, all-spice, wet wood, pepper amd wet grass. Full but still fresh flavour of orange-peels, cork, wet grass, minerals and spices. Long finish of mild spices, orange-peels, hay and wet wood. Quaffable and refreshing with its funky farmhouse character.

75 cl bottle purchased at La Cave à Bulles in Paris. Poured a clear golden color. Head was thick and white with good retention and lacing. Smelled of yeasty bread dough and corn bread with a twist of lemon. There was also an occasional whiff of clove. Dry and slightly acidic on the tongue with ample effervescence. Body was on the lighter end of the spectrum. Citrus and spice flavors predominate with a bit of melon, white wine, and light grain rounding things out. The 7% alcohol is fairly inconspicuous. Good beer. Thanks to Simon at La Cave à Bulles for this recommendation.

Courtesy SoLan.  Pours a hazy golden orange, with a thin, quickly dimishing white head.  Smells of some citrus, some spices, kind of like a spicy saison.  Some cinnamon and brown sugar as well.  Taste is somewhat mild, a little spicy.  Some funkiness as well, with a little sweet residue too.  Alot of orange citrus and spiciness dominate the flavors.  Really unique brew.  Interesting, but refreshing.  Quite good.

cloudy gold with a medium sized creamy white head.  bright floral/citrus aroma.  almost tripel-like with yeasty, marshmallow notes.  flavor is yeasty, grainy, banana.  a french wheat?  not really a biere de garde to me but it tastes good.

bottle at the Moan and Dove. Brewed with dandelions..atleast thats what I was told. nose is very earthy/soily with citrusy hops and yeasty bready notes present.  Flavor is equally earthy, with a pinch of funk, more chewy earth, a little saison spicieness and some beautiful yeast to tie  it all together. A nice brew, especially during these summer months.
Very nice blond beer. Good citrus and spices in both nose and taste. Full bodied and good balance. Excellent saison/biere de garde.  Wish i bought more of this stuff....
The beer poured a yellow color  with an earthy aroma and had a very spicy flavor with some carbonation.
UPDATED: OCT 4, 2011 This reminds me of Saison Dupont.  Sour aroma.  More barnyard weirdness than many saisons, or biere de gardes.  Cloudy.  Flavor has wheat and spices, some citrus.

Nice hazy golden orangish color.  Nice barnyard nose with a little grainy character as well.  The flavor is very nice with a slight carbonated feel accenting the saison like spiciness.  Finishes nice and dry and leaves a great grainy spicy feel on the tongue.

text: Hazy yellow color with a medium head.  Smells like a cool morning in a barn.  Very spicy taste, but cant quite nail down anything distinct.  Bitter orange peel finish.

Pours a hazed golden color, very effervescent, providing a good two inches of very thick creamy white head. Excellent head retention and exceptionally thick lace. A funky tangy citrus aroma is noticeable from a distance. Closer sniffs provide a sweeter lemonhead candy and a faint honeymalt fragrance.

A mild wheat malt flavor is up front - tart and dry. Behind this is a citrus tanginess - more lemon fruity than funky. A touch of grassy hop bitterness comes through in the finish. Lingering tartness isnt exactly bold, but isnt exactly subtle either. Smooth carbonation and medium body.

We have a gusher here!  Right at the pop of the cork about one quarter of the drink fizzed out the bottle top and ran down the drain.  Amazingly after pouring this pale, slightly hazy straw colored ale, the fizzy white head lasted for only a minute or so.  Not much of an aroma - meaning its faint - it smelled of grainy malt and sugars with a light floral scent hovering about.  Oily palate.  The flavor is sweet grainy malts, drying field grasses, soft fruits, and a very, very mild herbal bitterness.  Its okay, but not very exciting after the initial explosion.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Wine & Spirits, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>

Bottle from Knightly Spirits Orlando.

The body is lemon yellow and very active with carbonation bubbles. The head is two fingers thick and ridiculously bubbly/frothy making it look like white sea foam. A second top off produced a much creamier and more well formed head so the first pour could have been agitation.

The aroma is floral, grainy, slightly sharp a little dusty which tickles the nose and some mild sweetness that seems sugary, but could be malt.

Soft vanilla and old lemon in the fore with sweet grains and malt. Tongue tickling and herbal bitter through the middle. The finish is malt, lemongrass and a hint of bannana-like German Hefe flavor. Pretty interesting beer. A touch sweet, but still very drinkable and tasty.

Explosive cork self-extraction.  Hazy golden hay with a thin, persistent white head.  Beautiful, sweet light Belgian malt aromas of honey, pilsner malt, light tropical fruit, sweet floral perfume, fresh grains, vanilla, and a hint of yeasty bread dough.  The body is smooth and velvety with soft, tiny bubbles that easily glides across the tongue.  Chewy, layered malt dominates in the mouth, but there is little residual sweetness.  This beer is not incredibly complex or unnecessarily complicated or augmented, but it is fantastically enjoyable.  The simplicity of the style and the depth of quality ingredients makes this just a fantastic beer.  This reeks of dusty old farms and winter pining of summer warmth.

75 cl bottle with an over-eager champagne cork and a white foam that kept streaming out of the bottle. The colour is pale golden, just hazy if poured carefully, but with lots of sediment in the bottle. Strong coriander nose, like a Belgian wit. Fruity. Starting with sweet fruitiness,drying out towards the middle, leaving a dry and spicy finish. Quite fizzy. A nice wit-like beer- not much reminds me of a proper biere de garde, though.

Hazy gold, gushed a bit, big dusty/sweet/leafy/musty aroma, nice carbonic tingle, medium bodied with some flinty, minerally flavor but fairly dry, sort of a saison/biere de garde hybrid   but not terribly different from a strong belgian blonde. Further sipping reveals some tropical flavors, mango and passion fruit maybe, not strong or sweet but providing a nice balance. Have wondered about this beer for years, nice to finally try it and ultimately enjoy it.

30.04.06  I think this one was tasted at the HWOH.  I could be wrong.  Hazed golden color with ample white head that lasts.  Aromas are interesting and hoppy ofr a BdG, reminding more of the recent Ommegang than the plain Jenlain or malt-driven HW stuff.  Nice a floral on the nose with some light funk.  Sweet and malty beer without nearly as much malt presence on the palate as there was in the nose, and thats just fine.  I think this is a nicely done beer for the style.  Sweet and malty in the middle.  Finishes briskly with a nice bit of bitterness and more tart funk.

Bottle from Super Saver.  Hazy dull gold pour with 2-finger, frothy white head.  Aroma of citrus, floral and dry spicy notes, subdued hops, with some barnyardy hints.  The taste was semi-dry, floral, with heavy citric notes, and a very smooth, crisp palate.  It got a teeny bit hot as it warmed, but overall was a great example of this style, which is rapidly becoming a favorite of mine.

750 ml bottle stating "Mis en bout 05-06" and since it was purchased in April 06 (at Stateline Liquors in Elkton, MD) Id have to guess thats June 05.  Whatever.  Cellar termperature in a Chouffe tulip.  A very loud pop as the cork is released, freeing itself in the last moments without outside agency....an immediate musty smell upon opening, and a huge cumulous cloud of foam disgorges into the glass, gradually dissolving into a translucent bubbly body with thick, thick lacing....the nose at first seems skunky, to be honest, more like Heineken than La Bavaisienne, but on allowing it to breathe a bit some acerbic grassy qualities appear, and floral and honey sweetness smoothes things out....fortunately the body has no significant issues other than perhaps being slightly on the too-sweet end; overall though its rich and bready-malty with nice herbal, dry-hoppy character towards the finish, honey and orangepeel, a bit of buttery-caramel or toffee and a sprinkling of vanilla....if you can get past the harsh nose, its a fairly decent beer.

Bottle shared at the Moxs meetup in Baltimore a while ago.  Found some notes from the gathering on my desk today as I was cleaning up.  This one reminded me more of a nice saison than a beire de garde.  Pours a nice golden color with lots of floaties, cloudy and a nice lasting white head.  Aroma is lightly funky with some barnyard notes, lightly fruity, some wierd light banana esters, phenols and spice.  Flavor is nicely yeasty, slight citrus, light bready malts, finishes tart and dry with a lemony zest in the end.  Pretty good.

Hazy yellow/gold. Huge, foamy, white head settles to just a thin layer. Fresh, floral aroma with big grainy malt, crisp hops, and peppery yeast. Same flavor. Nicely balanced between bitter, sweet, and spicy. Dry, grainy finish. Smells like a freshly made soft corn tortilla as it warms. Easy drinking, well carbonated, medium body. Great for spring or summer.
Bottled.  Clear golden, very small head. Grassy buttery aroma. Medium sweet with light-medium body and sparkling mouthfeel. Feels fresh with its bready malt and grassy finish.

750 ml bottle:  Pours a hazy golden straw hue.  Fluffy thick white head, leaving substantial lacing.  Grassy, citrus, herbal, floral, pale fruit, bready/biscuity yeast nose.  Palate has similar flavors, as well as pear, apricot/peach, sudsy soapy, floral/herbal citrus, faintly underlying funk, meium body, crisp enjoyable finish.  A nice example, I hope to see more of this around soon.

Poured a hazy golden color with a small, white head that left light lacing on the glass.  Aroma of skunk, light grassy hops, lemon, and light sweet malts.  Taste of citrus, lemongrass, herbs, grassy hops, some yeast, and light alcohol as well.  Moderate carbonation.

750 ml bottle. Effervescent lemon yellow body with a uniform, sudsy, pure white head. Aroma of ripe pineapple, fresh pale grain, pale honey and an initial mild bathroom undertone that cleared fairly quickly. Flavor has a nice floral bouquet with mild yeasty spice and some pale malt and honey sweetness. A pleasant, flowery, pale bière de garde.

Bottle...  Murky, pear-colored ale with a small, fizzy, white head. Citrusy, spicy nose with notes of flora, grain and earth. The malty flavor is lightly bitter and spicy. Light-bodied with soft carbonation. Ends dry.
(750ml bottle) Hazy straw body topped by a medium white head.  Aroma is skunked, mild sweet, light lavender, yeast.  Taste is medium sweet, perfume, caramel/bread, some herbal.  Light, airy body.

A hazy orange beer with a small white head. The aroma is sweet spicy and yeasty, while the flavor besides the sweet yeatiness also has notes of flowers and hints of caramel. Inspite of its 7% ABV I find the body thin.

Musty, sweet, honey, hay-like aroma with some spicy notes and banana esters.  Hazy golden straw-coloured body with low but lasting fine-bubbled head that leaves some light lacing.  Strong floral hop flavour with fair bitterness and some farmy characteristics.  Medium body with very strong carbonation that prickles the tongue and awakens the tastebuds.  Sampled at GBBF 2005.

750ml bottle at GBBF, August 2005. Pale straw colour. Slightly hazy. Bottle conditioned. Fruity, with lots of apple character. Some soft underlying malt too. Noticeably estery. Not the most complex but a decent, refreshing beer. Not sure its really a biere de garde though.
Bottled. Pale yellow coloured. Yeasty aroma. Notes of banana and yeast in the flavour. Very sparkling and very thin.
Bottle (GBBF): Mild yellow colour. Musty malty yet not over the top. Nice farmy character with some good spicy notes. Really drinkable.

Pretty cellared 75cl sample  Orange beer with some coppergreen shine; fluffy off-white head fed by good carbonation leaving shards of lace. Nutty nose, some citrus, swinging to some coloured malt. Bitterish beer; background fully nutty and oxydized, sherry-like by age, but then again tending towards ambrée malt taste. Faraway flavours of olives and parsley, again some citrus. Dry, slightly burning MF, good carbonation and medium bodied, retaining some refreshing properties.  Bière de Garde  is a stylename a bit overused for any northern French beer. If you take it as a beer that can be laid down and survive, this is a good sample. Has always been one of my personal favourites in N. France. Although... French... made 1km exactly from the Belgian border, and on 3km from Brasserie des Rocs...

Bottled @ GBBF 2005: Yellow coloured. Dusty. White head. Wheat, malt and sweetness in the aroma. Some citric notes. Fruity and grapish notes in the flavour. Quite full bodied. Ends on a full sweet and fruity note, with some spice and cocoa notes as well. Good one.

Bouteille-Jai obtenu cette bouteille dun voyage en Belgique apr une amie. Il se peut quelle est été infectée. A cloudy orange with fast consuming foam. Fruity voire citrus taste with a sweet aftertaste maybe caramel.

On a trip to Belgium I aquired this beer from the local village. I got it back and after about 3 weeks I just opened it. carful opening this guy. I about put my eye out just opening the cage. It didnt foam over though. The aroma was of faint banannas, yeast, orange and lemon. appearance was a light straw color and only faintly hazy. flavor was orangy with a little residual malty sweetness fading into the estery belgian flavors. Not an outstanding beer but a good thirst quencher, which was the purpose of the style.
Little sweet. To many bubbles.
